Abe Attell.label: Abe Attell
Abe Attell.description: Abraham Washington "Abe" Attell, known in the boxing world as Abe "The Little Hebrew" Attell, was a boxer who became known for his record-setting six-year reign as World Featherweight Champion. Wikipedia
Abe Attell.Born: February 22, 1883, San Francisco, California, United States
Abe Attell.Died: February 7, 1970, New Paltz, New York, United States

Canada Lee.label: Canada Lee
Canada Lee.description: Canada Lee was an American actor who pioneered roles for African Americans. A champion of civil rights in the 1930s and 1940s, he died shortly before he was scheduled to appear before the House Un-American Activities Committee. Wikipedia
Canada Lee.Born: March 3, 1907, New York City, New York, United States
Canada Lee.Died: May 9, 1952, New York City, New York, United States

Benny Leonard.label: Benny Leonard
Benny Leonard.description: Benny Leonard was an American professional lightweight boxer. He was ranked 8th on the Ring Magazine's list of the "80 Best Fighters of the Last 80 Years" and #7 on ESPN's "50 Greatest Boxers of All-Time." Wikipedia
Benny Leonard.Born: April 17, 1896, New York City, New York, United States
Benny Leonard.Died: April 18, 1947, New York City, New York, United States

Audley Harrison.label: Audley Harrison
Audley Harrison.description: Audley Harrison is a professional boxer from Harlesden, England who fights in the heavyweight division. At the 2000 Olympics in Sydney he became the first British fighter to win an Olympic gold medal in the superheavyweight division. Wikipedia

Carlos Monzón.label: Carlos Monzón
Carlos Monzón.description: Carlos Monzón was an Argentine professional boxer who held the Undisputed World Middleweight Championship for 7 years. He successfully defended his title 14 times and is widely regarded as one of the greatest boxers of all time. Wikipedia
Carlos Monzón.Died: January 8, 1995, Santa Rosa de Calchines, Argentina

Billy Conn.label: Billy Conn
Billy Conn.description: William David "Billy" Conn was an American professional boxer and Light Heavyweight Champion famed for his fights with Joe Louis. He had a professional boxing record of 63 wins, 11 losses and 1 draw, with 14 wins by knockout. Wikipedia

David Haye.label: David Haye
David Haye.description: David "The Hayemaker" Haye is an English professional boxer from London and former WBA heavyweight champion. Wikipedia

Evander Holyfield.label: Evander Holyfield
Evander Holyfield.description: Evander Holyfield is a retired American professional boxer. He is a former Undisputed World Champion in both the cruiserweight and heavyweight divisions, earning him the nickname "The Real Deal." Wikipedia

Bobby Czyz.label: Bobby Czyz
Bobby Czyz.description:
Robert Edward Czyz is a retired American boxer. A New Jersey native of Polish descent, he is both a former world light heavyweight and cruiserweight champion.
Czyz was born in Orange, New Jersey. Wikipedia
Bobby Czyz.Born: February 10, 1962 (age 52), Orange, New Jersey, United States

Gene Tunney.label: Gene Tunney
Gene Tunney.description: James Joseph "Gene" Tunney was an American professional boxer and the world heavyweight champion from 1926–28. Wikipedia
Gene Tunney.Born: May 25, 1897, Manhattan, New York City, New York, United States

Freddie Mills.label: Freddie Mills
Freddie Mills.description: Frederick Percival "Freddie" Mills was an English boxer, and the world light heavyweight champion from 1948 to 1950. He was born in Bournemouth, Hampshire. Wikipedia

Chris Byrd.label: Chris Byrd
Chris Byrd.description: Chris Cornelius Byrd is a retired professional boxer. He is a former WBO and IBF heavyweight champion. His nickname is "Rapid Fire". Wikipedia

Harry Haft.label: Harry Haft
Harry Haft.description:
Harry Haft survivor of the Auschwitz concentration camp and a professional boxer in the United States during 1948–1949.
His father died when he was three years old. In 1939, when he was 14 years old, Haft witnessed the German occupation of Poland. Wikipedia

Gerrie Coetzee.label: Gerrie Coetzee
Gerrie Coetzee.description: Gerhardus Christian Coetzee is a South African former boxer. He was the first boxer from the African continent ever to fight for, and win, a world heavyweight title, holding the WBA version of the ... Wikipedia

Jack Johnson (boxer).label: Jack Johnson
Jack Johnson (boxer).description: John Arthur "Jack" Johnson, nicknamed the Galveston Giant was an American boxer, who—at the height of the Jim Crow era—became the first African American world heavyweight boxing champion. Wikipedia
Jack Johnson (boxer).Died: June 10, 1946, Franklinton, North Carolina, United States
Books: Jack Johnson in the ring and out

Horacio Accavallo.label: Horacio Accavallo
Horacio Accavallo.description:
Horacio Enrique Accavallo was an Argentine flyweight boxer who fought from 1956 until 1967. He retired with a record of 75 wins, 2 losses and 6 draws.
Accavallo fought mainly in Argentina. Wikipedia

Jürgen Brähmer.label: Jürgen Brähmer
Jürgen Brähmer.description: Jürgen Brähmer is a German boxer who is the current regular WBA Light Heavyweight Champion and former WBO Light Heavyweight Champion. He was WBO Inter-Continental super middleweight and WBC International super middleweight champion. Wikipedia

James J. Jeffries.label: James J. Jeffries
James J. Jeffries.description:
James Jackson Jeffries was an American professional boxer and former World Heavyweight Champion.
He was known for his enormous strength and stamina. Wikipedia

Harry Greb.label: Harry Greb
Harry Greb.description: Edward Henry "Harry" Greb was an American professional boxer. He was the World Middleweight Champion from 1923 to 1926 and the American Light Heavyweight Champion from 1922 to 1923. Wikipedia
Harry Greb.Died: October 22, 1926, Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States

Joe Louis.label: Joe Louis
Joe Louis.description: Joseph Louis Barrow, better known as Joe Louis, was an American professional boxer and the World Heavyweight Champion from 1937 to 1949. He is considered to be one of the greatest heavyweights of all time. Wikipedia
Joe Louis.Born: May 13, 1914, La Fayette, Alabama, United States
Awards: Associated Press Male Athlete of the Year

Joe Bugner.label: Joe Bugner
Joe Bugner.description: József Kreul "Joe" Bugner is a Hungarian-born British-Australian former heavyweight boxer and actor. He holds triple nationality, being a citizen of Hungary and a naturalized citizen of both Australia and the United Kingdom. Wikipedia

John L. Sullivan.label: John L. Sullivan
John L. Sullivan.description: John Lawrence Sullivan, also known as the Boston Strong Boy, was recognized as the first Heavyweight Champion of gloved boxing from February 7, 1882, to 1892, and is generally recognized as the last ... Wikipedia
John L. Sullivan.Born: October 15, 1858, Roxbury, Boston, Massachusetts, United States

John Ruiz.label: John Ruiz
John Ruiz.description: John "The Quietman" Ruiz is an American former professional boxer. Ruiz is the first Latino heavyweight champion and former two-time WBA heavyweight champion. Wikipedia

Jiro Watanabe.label: Jiro Watanabe
Jiro Watanabe.description:
Jiro Watanabe is a Japanese former boxer and current yakuza
Watanabe, who fought only in Japan and South Korea, was one of the first World Super flyweight champions, as the division was relatively new when he was crowned. Wikipedia

José \"King\" Roman.label: José "King" Roman
José \"King\" Roman.description: José "King" Roman is a Puerto Rican former boxer who was Puerto Rico's regional heavyweight champion. He is better known as "Joe King Roman." Wikipedia

Ken Norton.label: Ken Norton
Ken Norton.description: Kenneth Howard "Ken" Norton, Sr. was an American heavyweight boxer. He is a former WBC world heavyweight champion. Norton fought in one of the strongest heavyweight boxing scenes in history. He fought many top fighters during his career. Wikipedia

Jorge Páez.label: Jorge Páez
Jorge Páez.description: Jorge Adolfo Febles Páez is a Mexican boxer, actor and circus performer. Páez is the former WBO and IBF Featherweight champion. Paez is nicknamed "El Maromero", in honor of the acts he performs at the circus. Wikipedia

Kostya Tszyu.label: Kostya Tszyu
Kostya Tszyu.description: Konstantin Borisovich "Kostya" Tszyu is a semi-retired Russian-Australian professional boxer of mixed Russian, Korean and Mongol descent. Wikipedia

James J. Braddock.label: James J. Braddock
James J. Braddock.description:
James Walter "Cinderella Man" Braddock was an American boxer who was the world heavyweight champion from 1935–37.
Fighting under the name James J. Braddock, he was known for his powerful right hand, solid chin and comeback from a floundering career. Wikipedia
James J. Braddock.Born: June 7, 1905, New York City, New York, United States
James J. Braddock.Died: November 29, 1974, North Bergen, New Jersey, United States

Laila Ali.label: Laila Ali
Laila Ali.description: Laila Amaria Ali is a retired American professional boxer. She is the daughter of retired heavyweight boxing legend Muhammad Ali and his third wife, Veronica Porsche Ali. Laila is the eighth of her father's nine children and his youngest daughter. Wikipedia
Laila Ali.Born: December 30, 1977 (age 36), Miami Beach, Florida, United States

Ossie Ocasio.label: Ossie Ocasio
Ossie Ocasio.description: Osvaldo Ocasio, better known as Ossie Ocasio and nicknamed Jaws, is a Puerto Rican who was a boxer and world Cruiserweight champion. He got his peculiar nickname after accidentally biting another boxer during a sparring session. Wikipedia

Poli Díaz.label: Poli Díaz
Poli Díaz.description: Policarpo "Poli" Díaz Arevalo, better known simply as Poli Díaz is a former professional boxer. His record is 44-3. Wikipedia

Mia St. John.label: Mia St. John
Mia St. John.description: Mia Rosales St. John is a Mexican-American professional boxer and former WBC champion in the super welterweight division. She is also the IBA and IFBA lightweight champion. She is also a model, businesswoman, and taekwondo champion. Wikipedia
Mia St. John.Born: June 24, 1967 (age 46), San Francisco, California, United States
Movies and TV shows: Mia St. John's Million Dollar Workout

Pedro Montañez.label: Pedro Montañez
Pedro Montañez.description: Pedro Montañez was a boxer from Cayey, Puerto Rico. Also known as El Torito De Cayey, he has been considered by many to be one of the best boxers in history never to win a world title. In his career he was 92-7-4. Wikipedia

Sonny Liston.label: Sonny Liston
Sonny Liston.description: Charles L. "Sonny" Liston was an American professional boxer known for his toughness, punching power and intimidating appearance. He became World Heavyweight Champion in 1962 by knocking out Floyd Patterson in the first round. Wikipedia
Sonny Liston.Died: December 30, 1970, Las Vegas, Nevada, United States

Roberto Durán.label: Roberto Durán
Roberto Durán.description: Roberto Durán Samaniego is a retired Panamanian professional boxer, widely regarded as one of the greatest boxers of all time. A versatile brawler in the ring, he was nicknamed "Manos de Piedra" during his career. Wikipedia

Teófilo Stevenson.label: Teófilo Stevenson
Teófilo Stevenson.description: Teófilo Stevenson Lawrence, known as Teófilo Stevenson, was a Cuban amateur boxer. He is one of only three boxers to win three Olympic gold medals, alongside Hungarian László Papp and fellow Cuban Félix Savón. Wikipedia

Ralf Rocchigiani.label: Ralf Rocchigiani
Ralf Rocchigiani.description:
Ralf Rocchigiani is a boxer from Duisburg-Hamborn in Germany.
He was often overlooked due to his more talented and successful younger brother, Graciano Rocchigiani. Wikipedia

Sugar Ray Robinson.label: Sugar Ray Robinson
Sugar Ray Robinson.description: Sugar Ray Robinson was an American professional boxer. Frequently cited as the greatest boxer of all time, Robinson's performances in the welterweight and middleweight divisions prompted sportswriters ... Wikipedia
Sugar Ray Robinson.Died: April 12, 1989, Los Angeles, California, United States

Vinny Paz.label: Vinny Paz
Vinny Paz.description: Vinny Paz, formerly Vinny Pazienza is an Italian-American former boxer and world champion in the lightweight and light middleweight weight classes. He boxed under the nickname of "The Pazmanian Devil." Wikipedia
Vinny Paz.Born: December 16, 1962 (age 51), Cranston, Rhode Island, United States

Willie Pep.label: Willie Pep
Willie Pep.description: Guglielmo Papaleo was an American professional boxer, better known as Willie Pep. Pep boxed a total of 1,956 rounds in the 241 bouts during his 26-year career, a considerable number of rounds and fights even for a fighter of his era. Wikipedia
Willie Pep.Died: November 23, 2006, Rocky Hill, Connecticut, United States

Wilfredo Gómez.label: Wilfredo Gómez
Wilfredo Gómez.description: Wilfredo Gómez, sometimes referred to as Bazooka Gómez, is a former boxer and three-time world champion. Wikipedia

Adam Fogerty.label: Adam Fogerty
Adam Fogerty.description: Adam Heywood Fogerty is an English actor and former boxer and rugby league player. He is the son of Terry Fogerty, a rugby league player during the 1960s and '70s who played at club level for Halifax, ... Wikipedia

Muhammad Ali.label: Muhammad Ali
Muhammad Ali.description: Muhammad Ali is an American former professional boxer, generally considered among the greatest heavyweights in the sport's history. Wikipedia
Albums: The Adventures of Ali and His Gang vs. Mr. Tooth Decay

Vitali Tajbert.label: Vitali Tajbert
Vitali Tajbert.description:
Vitali Tajbert is a German boxer, who won a Featherweight Bronze medal at the 2004 Summer Olympics.
His family migrated from Kazakhstan as ethnic Germans to Stuttgart in 1992. Wikipedia

Mike Tyson.label: Mike Tyson
Mike Tyson.description: Michael Gerard "Mike" Tyson is an American retired professional boxer. Tyson is a former undisputed heavyweight champion of the world and holds the record as the youngest boxer to win the WBC, WBA and ... Wikipedia
Mike Tyson.Born: June 30, 1966 (age 47), Bedford-Stuyvesant, New York City, New York, United States
Movies: When Harry Met Sally 2 with Billy Crystal and Helen Mirren
Herman Cain's Campaign Promises with Mike TysonMore

Andre Routis.label: André Routis
Andre Routis.description: André Routis was a French professional boxer. He fought 86 times between 1919 and 1929; winning 54, losing 25 and drawing 7. After a victory over Tony Canzoneri he held the world featherweight title from 1928 to 1929. Wikipedia

Bob Hope.label: Bob Hope
Bob Hope.description: Bob Hope, KBE, KCSG, KSS, born Leslie Townes Hope, was an English-born American comedian, vaudevillian, actor, singer, dancer, author, and athlete who appeared on Broadway, in vaudeville, movies, television, and on the radio. Wikipedia
Bob Hope.Died: July 27, 2003, Toluca Lake, Los Angeles, California, United States
Awards: Golden Globe Cecil B. DeMille Award
Screen Actors Guild Life Achievement Award
Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Variety
People's Choice Award for Favorite All-Around Male Entertainer
People's Choice Award for Favorite TV Special
People's Choice Award for Favorite All-Time Entertainer

Dwight Muhammad Qawi.label: Dwight Muhammad Qawi
Dwight Muhammad Qawi.description: Dwight Muhammad Qawi is a former world boxing champion in the light heavyweight and cruiserweight divisions. He was inducted into the International Boxing Hall of Fame in 2004. Wikipedia

DaVarryl Williamson.label: DaVarryl Williamson
DaVarryl Williamson.description: DaVarryl Williamson is an American boxer originally from Washington, D.C., but later a resident of Aurora, Colorado. His ring nickname is "Touch of Sleep". He has a current professional record of 26-6, 22KO Wikipedia

Gary Stretch.label: Gary Stretch
Gary Stretch.description: Gary Stretch is an English actor, former boxer and former model. Wikipedia

Jock McAvoy.label: Jock McAvoy
Jock McAvoy.description: Joseph Patrick Bamford, better known by his ring name Jock McAvoy was a British boxer who fought from 1927 to 1945. Wikipedia

Jack Dempsey.label: Jack Dempsey
Jack Dempsey.description: William Harrison "Jack" Dempsey was an American professional boxer and cultural icon of the 1920s. He held the World Heavyweight Championship from 1919 to 1926. Wikipedia
Jack Dempsey.Died: May 31, 1983, New York City, New York, United States

Louis Monaco.label: Louis Monaco
Louis Monaco.description: Louis "The Facelifter" Monaco, is a professional boxer in the Heavyweight division and the former CAM Heavyweight Champion. Nicknamed "The Facelifter," Monaco is a clubfighter who fought several significant fighters of his era. Wikipedia

Boone Kirkman.label: Boone Kirkman
Boone Kirkman.description: Daniel Victor "Boone" Kirkman is a former amateur and professional Heavyweight boxer. He fought during the same era as George Foreman, Muhammad Ali, and Joe Frazier, which has been credited as being one of the greatest heavyweight eras of all time. Wikipedia

Max Schmeling.label: Max Schmeling
Max Schmeling.description: Maximillian Adolph Otto Siegfried "Max" Schmeling was a German boxer who was heavyweight champion of the world between 1930 and 1932. Wikipedia

Nate Campbell.label: Nate Campbell
Nate Campbell.description: Nathaniel Campbell III, more commonly known as Nate Campbell, is an American professional boxer. He is a former unified WBA, IBF and WBO lightweight champion. Wikipedia

Mike Alvarado.label: Mike Alvarado
Mike Alvarado.description: Mike Alvarado, is an American boxer in the Light Welterweight and Welterweight divisions. Alvarado is the IBF Latino Light Welterweight Champion. He is signed with Delgado Promotions and Top Rank. Wikipedia

Raymond Joval.label: Raymond Joval
Raymond Joval.description:
Raymond "Hallelujah" Joval is a professional boxer from the Netherlands and a former International Boxing Organization World Champion in the Middleweight class.
Joval represented the Netherlands at the 1992 Olympics. Wikipedia

Richard Herman.label: Richard Herman
Richard Herman.description: Richard H. Herman served as the Chancellor of the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign from 2005-2009. He previously served there as Provost and Vice Chancellor of Academic Affairs since 1998. Wikipedia

Lonnie Smith (boxer).label: Lonnie Smith
Lonnie Smith (boxer).description: Harlan Alonso Smith, known as Lonnie Smith, is an American boxer at Welterweight. Wikipedia

Terry Norris.label: Terry Norris
Terry Norris.description: Terry Wayne Norris is a retired American boxer and a three-time world champion in the light-middleweight division. Originally from Lubbock, Texas, he fought out of San Diego. Wikipedia

Rodolfo Gonzales.label: Rodolfo Gonzales
Rodolfo Gonzales.description: Rodolfo "Corky" Gonzáles was a Mexican American boxer, poet, and political activist. He convened the first-ever Chicano youth conference in March 1969, which was attended by many future Chicano activists and artists. Wikipedia

Young Corbett II.label: Young Corbett II
Young Corbett II.description: Young Corbett II is a boxer who held the world featherweight championship. He was He took the name "Young Corbett II" in honor of James J. Corbett, a heavyweight champion. Wikipedia

Ron Lyle.label: Ron Lyle
Ron Lyle.description: Ron Lyle was an American professional boxer in the heavyweight division. He is considered to have been one of the best contenders of his era and one of the best fighters never to win a world title. He was a crowd-pleasing power puncher. Wikipedia

Terron Millett.label: Terron Millett
Terron Millett.description: Terron Millett was a professional boxer in the Welterweight division and former IBF Light Welterweight Champion. Wikipedia
Terron Millett.Born: June 28, 1968 (age 45), Colorado Springs, Colorado, United States

Walter Wright (boxer).label: Walter Wright
Walter Wright (boxer).description:
Walter Wright is an American professional boxer.
As an amateur, Wright amassed a 90-12 record, including 4 straight Tacoma Golden Gloves titles, appearing in the finals of the 2001 u.s. amateur ... Wikipedia

Pornchai Thongburan.label: Pornchai Thongburan
Pornchai Thongburan.description: Pornchai Thongburan is a boxer from Thailand who competed in the Light Middleweight at the 2000 Summer Olympics and won the bronze medal. Wikipedia

Mansueto Velasco.label: Mansueto Velasco
Mansueto Velasco.description: Mansueto "Onyok" Velasco, Jr. is a Filipino boxer and comedian from Bago City, Negros Occidental, Philippines. Wikipedia

Adonis Stevenson.label: Adonis Stevenson
Adonis Stevenson.description: Stevenson Adonis is a Haitian-born Canadian professional boxer, who inverts his family name and given name, boxing as Adonis Stevenson and using the nickname "Superman". Wikipedia

Marijo Šivolija.label: Marijo Šivolija
Marijo Šivolija.description: Marijo Šivolija-Jelica is a Croatian amateur boxer best known to medal repeatedly in international competition at light heavyweight. Wikipedia

Roberto Balado.label: Roberto Balado
Roberto Balado.description: Roberto Balado Méndez was a Cuban boxer. At the 1992 Summer Olympics he won a Gold medal in the men's Super Heavyweight category. Wikipedia

Chi In-Jin.label: Chi In-Jin
Chi In-Jin.description: Chi In-jin is a South Korean former boxer in the featherweight division. He is a former World Boxing Council featherweight champion. Wikipedia

Albert Sosnowski.label: Albert Sosnowski
Albert Sosnowski.description: Albert Dariusz Sosnowski is a Polish professional boxer who fights in the heavyweight division. Wikipedia

Adrian Diaconu.label: Adrian Diaconu
Adrian Diaconu.description: Adrian Diaconu is a Romanian former professional boxer, who fought out of Montreal, Quebec, Canada. He is the former WBC Light Heavyweight Champion. Wikipedia

Alexander Abraham (boxer).label: Alexander Abraham
Alexander Abraham (boxer).description: Alexander "Alex" Abraham is a former Armenian-German professional boxer residing in Berlin, Germany. On 25 October 2008 he won the vacant EBU-EE light middleweight title from Roman Dzhuman and retained it twice. Wikipedia

Alfonso López III.label: Alfonso López III
Alfonso López III.description: Alfonso López III, is a Mexican American boxer in the Super Middleweight division and is the current WBC Continental Americas Super Middleweight Champion. He is trained by former title contender Roy Harris and Félix Ramírez. Wikipedia
Alfonso López III.Born: May 16, 1982 (age 31), Corpus Christi, Texas, United States

Alexander Alexeev.label: Alexander Alexeev
Alexander Alexeev.description: Alexander Vyacheslavovich Alekseev is a professional Cruiserweight boxer from Russia. Wikipedia

Alexander Frenkel.label: Alexander Frenkel
Alexander Frenkel.description: Alexander Frenkel is a German Cruiserweight boxer of Ukrainian origin ranked seventh in the world by Boxrec. Wikipedia

Andrew Lewis (boxing).label: Andrew Lewis
Andrew Lewis (boxing).description: Andrew Lewis is a professional boxer in the Middleweight division and is the former WBA World Welterweight Champion. Wikipedia

Andre Ward.label: Andre Ward
Andre Ward.description: Andre Ward is an American professional boxer and the current WBA and The Ring super middleweight champion, and former WBC super-middleweight champion. Ward was a gold medalist at the 2004 Summer Olympics. He won his first world championship in 2009. Wikipedia
Andre Ward.Born: February 23, 1984 (age 30), San Francisco, California, United States

Alfredo Escalera.label: Alfredo Escalera
Alfredo Escalera.description: Alfredo "El Salsero" Escalera is a Puerto Rican also known as Alfredo Escalera who was a world champion boxer. A native of Carolina, his nickname was "Salsero" because he was a fan of Salsa music. Wikipedia

Andy Bowen.label: Andy Bowen
Andy Bowen.description: Andy Bowen was an American boxer from New Orleans. His promising career was cut short due to in ring injuries suffered in a fight against Kid Lavigne in his home town of New Orleans. He was 27. Wikipedia
Andy Bowen.Born: May 3, 1867, New Orleans, Louisiana, United States
Andy Bowen.Died: December 15, 1894, New Orleans, Louisiana, United States

Austin Trout.label: Austin Trout
Austin Trout.description: Austin Dwayne Trout, is an American professional boxer who fights out of Las Cruces, New Mexico. He is a graduate of Mayfield High School in Las Cruces, New Mexico. Wikipedia
Austin Trout.Born: September 18, 1985 (age 28), Las Cruces, New Mexico, United States

Battling Nelson.label: Battling Nelson
Battling Nelson.description: Oscar Mathæus Nielsen, also known as Battling Nelson, was a Danish boxer who held the world lightweight championship on two separate occasions. He was nicknamed "the Durable Dane". Wikipedia

Beibut Shumenov.label: Beibut Shumenov
Beibut Shumenov.description: Beibut Shumenov, is a Kazakh professional boxer who fights in the Light Heavyweight division. He is the current WBA and IBA Light Heavyweight Champion. Wikipedia

Ann Wolfe.label: Ann Wolfe
Ann Wolfe.description: Ann Wolfe is a female boxer who held world titles in four different weight classes simultaneously. Wolfe is regarded by many within the sport as the hardest puncher and best fighter in the history of women's boxing. Wikipedia

Art Aragon.label: Art Aragon
Art Aragon.description: Arthur Benjamin Aragon was a Mexican-American boxer in the lightweight from New Mexico. Wikipedia
Art Aragon.Born: November 13, 1927, Belen, New Mexico, United States
Art Aragon.Died: March 25, 2008, Northridge, Los Angeles, California, United States

Bernardo Mercado.label: Bernardo Mercado
Bernardo Mercado.description: Bernardo Mercado was a heavyweight boxer briefly ranked as the top contender for the title of champion in 1980 by the WBC. Wikipedia

Bob Montgomery (boxer).label: Bob Montgomery
Bob Montgomery (boxer).description:
Bob Montgomery was an American lightweight boxer. He was born in Sumter, South Carolina.
Montgomery went undefeated in his first 23 fights, going 22-0-1 and winning the Pennsylvania State Lightweight Title.
Montgomery beat Julie Kogon three times. Wikipedia
Bob Montgomery (boxer).Born: February 10, 1919, Sumter, South Carolina, United States

Ben Caunt.label: Ben Caunt
Ben Caunt.description: Ben Caunt was a 19th-century English bare-knuckle boxer who became the "heavyweight" boxing champion known as the "Torkard Giant" and "Big Ben". Wikipedia

Bobo Olson.label: Bobo Olson
Bobo Olson.description: Carl Olson was an American boxer. He was the world middleweight champion between October 1953 and December 1955, the longest reign of any champion in that division during the 1950s, although he is ... Wikipedia

Bradley Saunders.label: Bradley Saunders
Bradley Saunders.description: Bradley Saunders is an English professional boxer who won a silver medal in the light welterweight division at the 2010 Commonwealth Games, gold at the 2009 European Union Amateur Boxing Championships ... Wikipedia

Bombardier Billy Wells.label: Bombardier Billy Wells
Bombardier Billy Wells.description: William Thomas Wells, better known as Bombardier Billy Wells, was an English heavyweight boxer. Fighting under the name "Bombardier Billy Wells," he was British and British Empire Champion from 1911 until 1919, defending his title fourteen times. Wikipedia

Buddy Baer.label: Buddy Baer
Buddy Baer.description:
Jacob Henry "Buddy" Baer was an American boxer.
In 2003, Baer was chosen for the Ring Magazine's list of 100 greatest punchers of all time. Wikipedia

Carl Froch.label: Carl Froch
Carl Froch.description: Carl Froch is an English professional boxer who fights as a super middleweight. As of 26 May 2012 Froch is the reigning IBF champion at super middleweight, having defeated Lucian Bute for the title, ... Wikipedia
